title: Unity and Ministry
shortSummary: Romans 15 emphasizes the call for believers to bear with one another in love, following Christ's example of selflessness. Paul highlights the inclusion of Gentiles in God's promises and outlines his ministry plans, encouraging unity, hope, and prayer among the believers.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul's Third Missionary Journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing to the Romans, explaining his ministry to the Gentiles and encouraging unity and hope among believers.

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The ultimate example of selflessness and servant leadership, who bore reproaches for others and received believers into God's glory.

keyCharacters.name: The Gentiles
keyCharacters.description: Non-Jewish believers who are included in God's plan of salvation and called to glorify God for His mercy.

keyCharacters.name: The Saints at Jerusalem
keyCharacters.description: The Jewish believers in Jerusalem who are recipients of the financial contribution from Macedonia and Achaia.

definitions.definition: Weaknesses or weaknesses in faith or character that stronger believers are called to bear with compassion.
A title referring to Jesus Christ’s role in fulfilling God's promises to the Jewish people.
Set apart as holy; made pure and acceptable to God through the work of the Holy Spirit.
The spiritual sacrifice of Gentile believers being presented to God as acceptable through Christ.

outline.heading: Bearing with the Weak and Unity in Christ
outline.description: Paul exhorts the strong believers to support the weak and to seek the good of their neighbors, following Christ’s example of selflessness and acceptance. This section underscores the importance of unity and glorifying God together.

outline.heading: Christ’s Ministry and the Inclusion of Gentiles
outline.description: Paul explains Christ’s role as minister to the Jews to confirm God’s promises and highlights the inclusion of Gentiles, supported by Old Testament prophecy, emphasizing God’s mercy and the universal scope of salvation.

outline.heading: Paul’s Ministry to the Gentiles
outline.description: Paul expresses confidence in the Roman believers’ goodness and knowledge, recounts his ministry efforts empowered by the Spirit, and his strategy to preach where Christ was not yet known to avoid building on others’ foundations.

outline.heading: Paul’s Travel Plans and Request for Prayer
outline.description: Paul shares his desire to visit Rome on his way to Spain, explains his current mission to Jerusalem to deliver a contribution for the poor saints, and earnestly requests the believers’ prayers for protection and acceptance of his service.

application: Bear patiently with the weaknesses of fellow believers, seeking to build them up rather than please yourself.
Emulate Christ’s example of selflessness and acceptance in your relationships within the church.
Trust in God’s promises and be encouraged by the hope and peace that come through the Holy Spirit.
Commit to praying earnestly for missionaries and church leaders as they carry out God’s work.

keyVerses.text: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for Christian unity and self-sacrificial love within the body of Christ.

keyVerses.text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the prayer for unity and collective worship as a reflection of Christ’s character.

keyVerses.text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
keyVerses.significance: This verse encourages believers to rely on the Holy Spirit for joy, peace, and overflowing hope.

keyVerses.text: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.
keyVerses.significance: Paul defines his calling to bring Gentiles to God as a holy and Spirit-empowered ministry.
